messages.subject: Re: Again... not Mr Han......
messages.msgSnippet: The book is about the Dutch collection of Nihinto and some koshirae. It will be a non-profit book. Mr. Han made more then 450 discriptions from swords in
messages.messageBody:
The book is about the Dutch collection of Nihinto and some koshirae.
It will be a non-profit book.
Mr. Han made more then 450 discriptions from swords in Holland.
(he made 1 mistake in 35 years of collecting, this sword didn't pas
shinsa)

Now he is getting older and he is stopping collecting swords.
The last sword he bought (back) was Fujiwara Sadakiyo from the
Yamato hosho school.
This blade was sold by Sothebys in the 1970's, he didn't bought it
that time.
It was in gunto mounts.
It was sold for 170 Dutch guldends, about 70US$.
10 years later he saw in the Token Bijutsu that it get Juyo.
So, from this time he want to buy it back.
2 years ago it was for sale again.
I was in Japan for the Kobe Taikai and I took it back for him to
Holland.

This kind of stories are also in the book, together with 40 pictures
from swords and some full colour pictures from koshirea.
Tanobe sensei did the foreword.

When people want to buy this book,,, then let me know.

John

messages.subject: Again... not Mr Han......
messages.msgSnippet: Hello, Mr. Han s wife past away 2 days ago on a age of 71. So, Mr. Han is still alive. I know Mr. Han very well. I it is a realy pitty for him that his wife
messages.messageBody:
Hello,

Mr. Han's wife past away 2 days ago on a age of 71.
So, Mr. Han is still alive.

I know Mr. Han very well.
I it is a realy pitty for him that his wife past away just a few weeks
before there 50 years of marriage.
Also on the 10 Oktober we planned to intoduce the a book from the Dutch
Token.
More then 70% of the blades are from Mr. Han Bing Siong and all his
discription and articles.

Selamat Jalan,,,, Mrs Han.

John Klein Nagelvoort
The Netherlands




>From: "alchemyst" <alchemyst@...>
>Reply-To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
>To: nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com
>Subject: [nihontostudy] Han Bing Siong passed away
>Date: Wed, 24 Sep 2003 12:00:44 -0000
>
>Forward from Rich T's message board:
>
>I have just received an email from a Oranda Token Kai member telling
>me on the passing yesterday of Han Bing
> Siong. He was well known for his pentrating erudite scholarly
>works that reguarly appeared in the English and
> Japanese language sword journals like Token Bijutsu, JSS/US and
>Token Society of Great Britain.
>
> I shall never forget how he answered every query I had however
>insignificant and always had time for the younger
> element. He once wrote, 'I don't feel its a waste of time to
>answer any thing you ahve to write Yahya for you are next
> generation that must carry on what he started after the war.'
>
> RIP good friend
>
> We'll miss you.
>
> Yahya Abdelsamad
>
